20/* Id */
21
22#ifndef ISC_STDTIME_H
23#define ISC_STDTIME_H 1
24
25/*! \file */
26
27#include <isc/lang.h>
28#include <isc/int.h>
29
30/*%
31 * It's public information that 'isc_stdtime_t' is an unsigned integral type.
32 * Applications that want maximum portability should not assume anything
33 * about its size.
34 */
35typedef isc_uint32_t isc_stdtime_t;
36
37/* but this flag helps... */
38#define STDTIME_ON_32BITS 1
39
40/*
41 * isc_stdtime32_t is a 32-bit version of isc_stdtime_t. A variable of this
42 * type should only be used as an opaque integer (e.g.,) to compare two
43 * time values.
44 */
45typedef isc_uint32_t isc_stdtime32_t;
46
47ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
48/* */
49void
50isc_stdtime_get(isc_stdtime_t *t);
51/*%<
52 * Set 't' to the number of seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970.
53 *
54 * Requires:
55 *
56 *\li 't' is a valid pointer.
57 */
58
59#define isc_stdtime_convert32(t, t32p) (*(t32p) = t)
60/*
61 * Convert the standard time to its 32-bit version.
62 */
63
64ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
65
66#endif /* ISC_STDTIME_H */
67
